meanings.definition: To possess or dominate the mind of someone in advance.
meanings.sent1: The idea of going to the amusement park prepossesses him.
meanings.sent2: Her kindness prepossesses everyone she meets.
meanings.sent3: His love for pizza prepossesses his thoughts, making him crave it constantly.
meanings.sent4: The majestic mountain prepossesses the landscape, drawing all eyes towards it.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious book prepossesses the reader, leaving them eager to uncover its secrets.

meanings.sent1: The delicious aroma of freshly baked cookies prepossesses her senses.
meanings.sent2: His charming smile prepossesses everyone he meets.
meanings.sent3: The adorable puppy prepossesses the family, making them instantly fall in love.
meanings.sent4: The stunning artwork prepossesses the viewers, leaving them in awe of the talent.
meanings.sent5: The captivating story prepossesses the audience, keeping them engaged till the end.
